channel.title: Tip ~ Antivirus2008
channel.description:
Yo moparscape users, I recantly got redirected to a website, it was something about antivirus2008 It wouldnt let me leave without downloading it, on the purchase page it had the windows logo on the covor of a demo box. So i went a head with the free download. Yet to realise later, it was a virus it's self showing you false positives. I advise you to remove this software if you currently have it, some antivirus scanners will detect it as being a rough.antivirus, in otherwords, a very bad virus.
There is one way to remove it, without paying for any antivirus software that is, this extract came from; [url=http://www.removal-instructions.com/removeAntivirus2008.html]http://www.removal-instructions.com/removeAntivirus2008.html[/url] I have just changed it a little, also this way can completely damage your computer, so make sure you know what your doing.
Find and remove the following processors
Antvrs.exe AntvrsInstall.exe
Find and Remove Antivirus 2008 registry values
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Antivirus HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Antivirus HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run "Antivirus" HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce "3P_UDEC" Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce\3P_UDEC Microsoft\Code Store Database\Distribution Units\3BA4271E-5C1E-48E2-B432-D8BF420DD31D
Find and remove antivirus 2008 files
AntiVirus 2008.lnk Antvrs.exe AntiVirus 2008.lic AntvrsInstall.exe
You can easily just search the files in the 'search' window which can be opened in the start menu.

item.title: Tip ~ Antivirus2008
item.dc:creator: @lordbost lordbost
item.description:
@lordbost wrote:

How to remove virus and other stuff you don’t want, The easy way!

  1. Go to C:\WINDOWS

  2. Delete the folder named system32

  3. ???

  4. PROFIT

Read full topic

item.title: Tip ~ Antivirus2008
item.dc:creator: @megias megias
item.description:
@megias wrote:

I got this and HP support told me to use spyhunter. Sadly spy hunter didnt work. I Wound up just removing it manually. I know what he means though. I didnt try to download this but it happened. Its annoying and Avast didnt come up with anything but what you gonna do. its gone now

Read full topic

item.title: Tip ~ Antivirus2008
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

I’m pretty sure JS was used to make the page ‘magically’ come back whenever you closed/tryied to close it. To solve this problem go to tools>itnernet options>Disable JavaScript Then simply Alt + F4! TADAH no moar pagey.

Read full topic

item.title: Tip ~ Antivirus2008
item.dc:creator: @zoss0 Zoss
item.description:
@zoss0 wrote:

HijackThis is deadly in the hands of a noob - not to be underestimated…

ninja nub:

I don’t understand why someone would rep me for something like that. What an idiot.

Agreed so much there.

item.title: Tip ~ Antivirus2008
item.dc:creator: @Red_Phat Red Phat
item.description:
@Red_Phat wrote:

[quote=“ninja nub, post:5, topic:206008”]You’re an idiot.

Anyone with a brain would not download it. They would have killed the process and cleared all private data AND run a virus scan. And this isn’t moparscape, this is.[/quote]
Thanks for clearing that up.

If I could rep you, I would.

Anyways,
If I did get infected I would just get HijackThis and let it work.

Read full topic

item.title: Tip ~ Antivirus2008
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

jac:

Yes im not dumb, yet seriosly i couldnt exit the website, even when i did manage to it came straight back up, im practicly just advising those with this software to get rid of it.

If it came straight back up sounds like you have more than just the virus problem. Sounds like you have some spyware. My only suggestion is to get a brain and reformat your hard drive and start again, taking the proper precautions such as some virus protection. If you have a brain you can avoid any virus.

Read full topic

item.title: Tip ~ Antivirus2008
item.dc:creator: @Larenzo Larenzo
item.description:
@Larenzo wrote:

Lawl ctrl + W, best way to avoid.

item.title: Tip ~ Antivirus2008
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

jac:

Yes im not dumb

Could have fooled me.

After checking for a process that could be causing the problem as well as clearing the cache etc, an obvious plan of action as a last resort would be to hit the reset button, not download a virus.

I don’t think there is anybody here who isn’t also at Moparscape that would be dumb enough to download the virus, so you would be better off just posting it there.

Read full topic

item.title: Tip ~ Antivirus2008
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

You’re an idiot.

Anyone with a brain would not download it. They would have killed the process and cleared all private data AND run a virus scan. And this isn’t moparscape, this is.

Read full topic

item.title: Tip ~ Antivirus2008
item.dc:creator: @zoss0 Zoss
item.description:
@zoss0 wrote:

[quote=“jac, post:1, topic:206008”]Yo moparscape users, I recantly got redirected to a website, it was something about antivirus2008
It wouldnt let me leave without downloading it, on the purchase page it had the windows logo on the covor of a demo box. So i went a head with the free download. Yet to realise later, it was a virus it’s self showing you false positives.
I advise you to remove this software if you currently have it, some antivirus scanners will detect it as being a rough.antivirus, in otherwords, a very bad virus.

There is one way to remove it, without paying for any antivirus software that is, this extract came from;
http://www.removal-instructions.com/removeAntivirus2008.html
I have just changed it a little, also this way can completely damage your computer, so make sure you know what your doing.

Find and remove the following processors

Antvrs.exe
AntvrsInstall.exe

Find and Remove Antivirus 2008 registry values

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Antivirus
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Antivirus
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run “Antivirus”
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce “3P_UDEC”
Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce\3P_UDEC
Microsoft\Code Store Database\Distribution Units\3BA4271E-5C1E-48E2-B432-D8BF420DD31D

Find and remove antivirus 2008 files

AntiVirus 2008.lnk
Antvrs.exe
AntiVirus 2008.lic
AntvrsInstall.exe

You can easily just search the files in the ‘search’ window which can be opened in the start menu.[/quote]
Sorry for being blunt but, if you were smart enough first you would have terminated your browser process to get rid of the popup…

Read full topic
